entry.title: Gediminas' Cap (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the inaugurations of Lithuanian monarchs, Gediminas' Cap (depicted) was placed on the monarch's head by the bishop of Vilnius?

entry.title: Day of Books and Roses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that today is the Day of Books and Roses, which originated in Barcelona in 1926 as the Day of the Book, described as a "festival of civility and intelligence"?

entry.title: Jeff Wrana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 2009 Jeff Wrana helped to develop a biological model that might play a role in predicting whether a woman is more likely to recover from breast cancer?

entry.title: today's London Marathon (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the elite men's event at today's London Marathon will feature four of the five fastest competitors of all time?

entry.title: Philippine embassy in Manama (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the first ambassador at the Philippine embassy in Manama would later be injured in the 2000 bombing of the Philippine embassy in Jakarta?

entry.title: Matt Hicks (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that NIU dormitory residents cast 65,000 write-in votes to elect Matt Hicks to the 1977 Pizza Hut All-American game?

entry.title: Leeds Convention (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 1917 Leeds Convention in Britain passed resolutions calling for the end of the First World War and praising the February Revolution in Russia?

entry.title: Starrett–Lehigh Building (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 19-story Starrett–Lehigh Building was built on the principle of "every floor a first floor"?
